alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued May 24 at 8:24PM EDT until May 25 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM EDT THURSDAY THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents expected. * WHERE...The Delaware and New Jersey beaches. * WHEN...Thursday and Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...Strong rip currents and hazardous surf conditions. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: It is recommended to remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. However if caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
